date: 2025-02-03
---

## GAD-7 vs PLIKS

When conducting psychology research, cross-study comparisons can greatly enhance the validity of your findings. A common scenario encountered by psychologists is the need to compare between the Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7) and the Psychotic-like Symptoms (PLIKS). However, comparing these two is not an easy task, as they each focus on different psychological dimensions. This is where Harmony comes into play. In the case of GAD-7 vs PLIKS, Harmony uses sophisticated natural language processing and AI systems to compare and harmonise items from both instruments, providing a percentage match and helping ensure an accurate comparison between GAD-7 and PLIKS. Harmony is not only effective in comparing items within a common language but can seamlessly assess items across different languages. In the process of comparing GAD-7 vs PLIKS, researchers can drag and drop their own instruments in PDF form or select instruments from Harmony's comprehensive database. Harmony's easy-to-use web interface at https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app simplifies the process and makes it easier for researchers to compare these two instruments. Making comparisons such as GAD-7 vs PLIKS isn't a simple task, especially when considering different studies and languages. Harmony is a tool that ensures precise, accurate, and effective harmonisation. With Harmony, researchers can focus more on analysis and interpretation as opposed to the time-consuming process of manual comparison. Therefore, when entering into the GAD-7 vs PLIKS debate, using Harmony will undoubtedly provide more reliable and insightful results.

## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
